caption.p: Congenital herpes simplex virus (HSV) infection. Disseminated HSV infection may be acquired by a neonate through exposure to infected cervicovaginal secretions. ( a) The pneumonitis that results is characterized by patchy zones of necrosis and hemorrhage, in this case also associated with early metaplasia of the bronchiolar respiratory epithelium (H&E, 40×). ( b) At higher power, occasional herpes-infected cells at the periphery of the necrotic areas show typical Cowdry A type intranuclear inclusions ( arrow) (H&E, 200×)
